question_text: The length of a rectangle is 12 centimeters (cm) and the width is 7 centimeters (cm). What is the area, in cm$^2$, of the rectangle?
subject: Math

question_text: The area of a rectangular garden is 48 square feet. If the width of the garden is 6 feet, what is the length, in feet, of the garden?
subject: Math

question_text: Triangle PQR and triangle XYZ are similar triangles, where PQ and XY are corresponding sides. If XY = 3PQ and the perimeter of triangle PQR is 15, what is the perimeter of triangle XYZ?
subject: Math

question_text: A rectangle has a length of 15 and a width of 7. What is the area of the rectangle?
subject: Math

question_text: A rectangular garden has a length of 15 meters and a width of 12 meters. What is the area, in square meters, of the garden?
subject: Math

question_text: The area of a rectangular banner is 360 square centimeters. The width of the banner is 9 centimeters. What is the length, in centimeters, of this banner?
subject: Math

question_text: A square garden has a side length of 5 meters. What is the area of the garden in square meters?
subject: Math

question_text: A square garden has a side length of 25 feet. What is the area, in square feet, of the garden?
subject: Math

question_text: The figure shows the lengths, in centimeters (cm), of the edges of a right rectangular prism. The volume $V$ of a right rectangular prism is given by the formula $V = lwh$, where $l$ is the length, $w$ is the width, and $h$ is the height of the prism. What is the volume, in cubic centimeters, of the prism?
subject: Math

question_text: A sail on a sailboat is in the shape of a triangle. If the base of the sail is 25 feet and the height of the sail is 32 feet, what is the area, in square feet, of the sail?
subject: Math

question_text: What is the area, in square feet, of a rectangular garden with a length of 12 feet and a width of 5 feet?
subject: Math

question_text: A right circular cone has a volume of $24\pi$ cubic inches. If the radius of the base of the cone is 3 inches, what is the height of the cone?
subject: Math

question_text: A triangle has a base of 6 and a height of 4. What is the length of one side of a square that has the same area as this triangle?
subject: Math

question_text: A shipping box is shaped like a right rectangular prism. The base of the box has a width of 8 inches and a length of 12 inches. If the volume of the box is 960 cubic inches, what is the height of the box in inches?
subject: Math

question_text: A company manufactures cylindrical pipes in two sizes. Both sizes have a length of 10 meters. The radius of pipe X is 20 centimeters, and the radius of pipe Y is 10% longer than the radius of pipe X. What is the volume, in cubic centimeters, of pipe Y?
subject: Math

question_text: A circular fountain has a diameter of 20 feet. What is the approximate circumference, in feet, of the fountain? Use 3.14 for $\pi$.
subject: Math

question_text: A triangular prism has a height of 12 centimeters (cm) and a volume of 300 cm³. What is the area, in cm², of the base of the prism? (The volume of a triangular prism is equal to $Bh$, where $B$ is the area of the base and $h$ is the height of the prism.)
subject: Math

question_text: A rectangular box containing granola is filled to the top with milk after the granola is added. The base of the box is a rectangle with dimensions 8 cm by 5 cm, and the height of the box is 9 cm. If 220 cm³ of milk is needed to fill the box to the top after the granola is added, what is the total volume of the granola in the box?
subject: Math

question_text: A party hat is shaped like a right circular cone. The party hat can hold a maximum volume of $125\pi$ cubic centimeters. The radius of the circular base is 5 centimeters. What is the height of the party hat, in centimeters?
subject: Math

question_text: In the xy-plane shown, square ABCD has its diagonals on the x- and y-axes.  What is the area, in square units, of the square?
subject: Math

question_text: A spherical water tank has a diameter of 10 feet. What is the volume, in cubic feet, of water the tank can hold when full?
subject: Math

question_text: A right circular cylinder has a volume of 450 cubic centimeters. The area of the base of the cylinder is 15 square centimeters. What is the height, in centimeters, of the cylinder?
subject: Math

question_text: A right circular cylinder has a volume of 540 cubic centimeters. The base area of the cylinder is 36 square centimeters. What is the height, in centimeters, of the cylinder?
subject: Math

question_text: The figure shown is a right circular cylinder with a radius of $r$ and height of $h$. A second right circular cylinder (not shown) has a volume that is 108 times as large as the volume of the cylinder shown. Which of the following could represent the radius $R$, in terms of $r$, and the height $H$, in terms of $h$, of the second cylinder?
subject: Math

question_text: A right circular cylinder has a height of 14 centimeters (cm) and a base with a diameter of 10 cm. The volume of this cylinder is $n\pi$ cm$^3$. What is the value of n?
subject: Math

question_text: A soup company designs cans in the shape of right cylinders. To optimize material, the height of each can is designed to be 1.5 times the diameter of its base. Which of the following expressions represents the volume, $V$, in cubic centimeters, of such a can, where $r$ is the radius of the base in centimeters?
subject: Math

question_text: A rectangular garden has an area of 500 square feet. To reduce water consumption, the gardener decides to reduce both the length and the width of the garden by 10%. What is the area of the new garden, in square feet?
subject: Math

question_text: A right circular cylinder has a radius of 5 centimeters (cm) and a height of 12 cm. What is the volume, in cm$^3$, of the right circular cylinder in terms of $\pi$?
subject: Math

question_text: A right circular cone used as a party hat has a volume of $15\pi$ cubic inches and a height of 5 inches. What is the radius, in inches, of the circular base of the party hat?
subject: Math

question_text: The volume of right circular cylinder A is 22 cubic centimeters. What is the volume, in cubic centimeters, of a right circular cylinder with triple the radius and one-third the height of cylinder A?
subject: Math

question_text: What is the area, in square units, of the triangle formed by connecting the three points shown: (1, 2), (6, 1), and (4, -2)?
subject: Math

question_text: The dimensions of a right rectangular prism are 7 inches by 8 inches by 9 inches. What is the surface area, in square inches, of the prism?
subject: Math

question_text: Circle P and Circle Q are similar. The radius of Circle P is one-third the radius of Circle Q. The area of Circle Q is $81\pi$ square inches. What is the area, in square inches, of Circle P?
subject: Math

question_text: A cube has a surface area of 96 square meters. What is the volume, in cubic meters, of the cube?
subject: Math

question_text: A right circular cylinder has a radius of 3 units. The volume of the cylinder is $126\pi$ cubic units. What is the height, in units, of the cylinder?
subject: Math

question_text: The line segment shown in the xy-plane represents one of the legs of a right triangle. The line segment connects points (1, 1) and (4, 1). The area of this triangle is $12\sqrt{2}$ square units. What is the length, in units, of the other leg of this triangle?
subject: Math

question_text: Rectangles ABCD and EFGH are similar. The length of EFGH is 4 times the length of the corresponding side of ABCD. The area of ABCD is 15 square units. What is the area, in square units, of EFGH?
subject: Math
